channel.title: Starter more then once?

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:13, topic:267737”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=353450.msg2709042#msg2709042 date=1237168953]

If you’re asking if this would lag your server, then the answer to that is no.

How does it store the information?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2009, 08:03:21 pm[/size][hr]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,353505.0.html - qwertyuiop, can you help me there?
[/quote]
It stores the names of the players in a HashSet in the Client class.
When you call starters.add(element), it attempts to add that element to the set and returns true if it was successfully added. If the element was already contained in the set, it returns false.

I’ll see if I can help you with your problem.
I don’t really understand how NPC dialogue works, but I’ll give it a shot.[/quote]
Thanks for explaining

Read full topic

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:12, topic:267737”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=353450.msg2709041#msg2709041 date=1237168822]
If you’re asking if this would lag your server, then the answer to that is no.
[/quote]
How does it store the information?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2009, 08:03:21 pm[/size][hr]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,353505.0.html - qwertyuiop, can you help me there?[/quote]
It stores the names of the players in a HashSet in the Client class.
When you call starters.add(element), it attempts to add that element to the set and returns true if it was successfully added. If the element was already contained in the set, it returns false.

I’ll see if I can help you with your problem.
I don’t really understand how NPC dialogue works, but I’ll give it a shot.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:8, topic:267737”][quote] public int starter = 0; not needed; we are using a set for this
private static java.util.Set starters = new java.util.HashSet(); // must be static

Next:

        		[s]characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);[/s]
        		[s]characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0,[/s]
                		[s]Integer.toString(starter).length());[/s] unnecessary unless you wish to keep all the starters logged after the server is shutdown. you should probably just log all the names to a single file instead of char files and load them into the set on startup

Final:

   if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
        if (starters.add(playerName)) { // returns true if the player was successfully added to the set, so if they were already in the set it will return false
                 addItem(995, 2500000);
                 sendMessage("Crypted-Online Starter Package");
        } else {
                 sendMessage("Sorry.");
                 PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                         + " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }

[/quote][/quote]
Never heard of this, it’s cool. Would this cause any lag for the console to store the information?

Read full topic

[s]public int starter = 0;[/s] not needed; we are using a set for this private [b]static[/b] java.util.Set starters = new java.util.HashSet(); // must be static

Next:

        		[s]characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);[/s]
        		[s]characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0,[/s]
                		[s]Integer.toString(starter).length());[/s] unnecessary unless you wish to keep all the starters logged after the server is shutdown. you should probably just log all the names to a single file instead of char files and load them into the set on startup

Final:

   if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
        if (starters.add(playerName)) { // returns true if the player was successfully added to the set, so if they were already in the set it will return false
                 addItem(995, 2500000);
                 sendMessage("Crypted-Online Starter Package");
        } else {
                 sendMessage("Sorry.");
                 PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                         + " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

    }</blockquote>

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

what do you mean? this is everything i added:

[code] public int starter = 0;
private java.util.Set starters = new java.util.HashSet();

Next:

        		characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
        		characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0,
                		Integer.toString(starter).length());

Final:

   if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
        if (starter == 0)	
        if (starters.add(playerName)) {
                 addItem(995, 2500000);
                 sendMessage("Crypted-Online Starter Package");
                 starter = 1;
                 savechar();
        } else if (starter == 1) {
                 sendMessage("Sorry.");
                 PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                         + " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }

[/code] Help pl0x.

Read full topic

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Add people’s names to a HashSet when they use the command and check the set for their name whenever they try using it.

[code]
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starters.add(playerName)) {
addItem(995, 2500000);
sendMessage(“Crypted-Online Starter Package”);
savechar();
} else {
sendMessage(“Sorry.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Starter more then once?
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

I added this starter command in:

[code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 2500000);
sendMessage(“Crypted-Online Starter Package”);
starter = 1;
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Sorry.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }[/code]

And this public int:

 public int starter = 0;

And now everytime you relog, you can get another starter. Help please.

Read full topic
